name: Barn on the River Bed and Breakfast

reviews.text: a large number of family members had the most glorious week we could imagine in this hidden jewel nestled deep within the colorado mountains. the fireplace in our room was used to warm the chilly nights, and the roomy shower was used and loved after white water rafting. (the extra friendly innkeepers gave us a coupon). we used the kitchen and took turns cooking when not eating at a wonderful restaurant. there is so much to do and see in this part of the country. we hated to leave this homey, friendly inn. what a find!!!! p.s. our kids loved the hot tub.
reviews.title: we almost stayed on and on and on.........
Customer service that went above and beyond
reviews.text: We stayed at the Barn on the River a couple weeks ago, to finish off our week-long road-trip around Colorado. Just as other reviewers have noted, the service offered by the hosts, Diane and Fred, was exceptional, from the helpful recommendations for local restaurants, to the clean and comfortable room, to the relaxing hot tub after the long day's drive. Breakfast was extremely well prepared -- ours was a Mexican-style breakfast burrito, chock-full of fresh veggies and with a delicious cheese sauce.

reviews.title: Improved on Perfection?
reviews.text: What I will remember most, however, was how helpful Diane was after we'd left town, when I realized I'd left my camera somewhere in Breckenridge. In spite of whatever she might have had planned when I called in a panic, she went in search of my camera, and eventually made arrangements to have it shipped to me. I am most grateful for her kindness!

reviews.title: Barn on the River/A+++++
reviews.text: Characterful, spotlessly clean & comfortable room with great attention to detail throughout the property. For example: slippers with non-slip soles provided for use inside the house and flip-flops & robes provided for going to & from the hot-tub.
